render.figure_dynamics module

Author: Alec Glisman (GitHub: @alec-glisman)
Date: 2023-11-24
Description: Module to render figures for time series data.

Functions

render.figure_dynamics.opes_dynamics(df: pandas.DataFrame, cv: str = 'dist_chain.z', dir_fig: str = 'figures') → matplotlib.pyplot.Figure[source]

Render a figure of the OPES bias dynamics. This figure should be used to assess the convergence of the OPES bias. The figure contains 8 subplots: - CV: curve should show rapid sampling of the entire CV space - OPES Bias: bias should be slowly increasing over time - Lower wall bias: should hopefully be near zero for most of the simulation - Upper wall bias: should hopefully be near zero for most of the simulation - OPES time constant: should increase and converge to a constant as the bias

becomes quasi-static

  • OPES normalization constant: starts from 1 an changes significantly when

    a new region of CV space is explored

  • OPES number of effective samples: should be increasing over time with

    a fixed ratio to the number of samples

  • OPES number of compressed kernels: should increase and plateau

dfpd.DataFrame

DataFrame containing the OPES bias dynamics.

cvstr, optional

Name of the collective variable, by default “dist_chain.z”

dir_figstr, optional

Directory to save the figure, by default “figures”

plt.Figure

Figure of the OPES bias dynamics.

render.figure_dynamics.metad_dynamics(df: pandas.DataFrame, cv: str = 'dist_chain.z', dir_fig: str = 'figures') → matplotlib.pyplot.Figure[source]

Render a figure of the MetaD bias dynamics. This figure should be used to assess the convergence of the MetaD bias. The figure contains 6 subplots: - CV: curve should show rapid sampling of the entire CV space - MetaD Bias: bias should be slowly increasing over time - Lower wall bias: should hopefully be near zero for most of the simulation - Upper wall bias: should hopefully be near zero for most of the simulation - MetaD time constant: should increase over time - MetaD bias: should increase and plateau

dfpd.DataFrame

DataFrame containing the MetaD bias dynamics.

cvstr, optional

Name of the collective variable, by default “dist_chain.z”

dir_figstr, optional

Directory to save the figure, by default “figures”

plt.Figure

Figure of the MetaD bias dynamics.

render.figure_dynamics.cv_replica_dynamics(dfs: list[pandas.DataFrame], cv: str = 'dist_chain.z', dir_fig: str = 'figures') → matplotlib.pyplot.Figure[source]

Render a figure of the collective variable dynamics for each replica. This figure should be used to assess the sampling of the collective variable space across replicas. The figure contains 8 subplots, one for each replica.

dfslist[pd.DataFrame]

List of DataFrames containing the collective variable dynamics for each replica.

cvstr, optional

Name of the collective variable, by default “dist_chain.z”

dir_figstr, optional

Directory to save the figure, by default “figures”

plt.Figure

Figure of the collective variable dynamics for each replica.
